Line 1: Line 1: â
[[Image:Hogwarts.jpg|thumb|300px|right|[[Hogwarts]], a wizarding school as shown in the [[Harry Potter (film series)|Harry Potter film series]].]]
 
The '''[[fictional universe]]''' of [[J. K. Rowling]]'s '''''[[Harry Potter]]''''' series of fantasy novels comprises two separate and distinct societies: the '''wizarding world''' and the '''[[Muggle]] world'''. The Muggle world is the series' name for the world inhabited by the non-magical majority, with the wizarding world existing [[wikt:coextensive|coextensively]] with it but hidden from the awareness of the non-magical "[[Muggle]]s". The plot of the series is set in contemporary [[Great Britain]], but in a veiled and separate shadow society in which [[Magic in Harry Potter|magic]] is real, and those who can use it live in enforced seclusion, hiding their talents from the real world. The term "wizarding world" refers to the global wizard community that lives hidden in parallel with the Muggle world; the different terms refer to different communities within the same area rather than separate [[planets]] or worlds.
The '''[[fictional universe]]''' of [[J. K. Rowling]]'s '''''[[Harry Potter]]''''' series of fantasy novels comprises two separate and distinct societies: the '''wizarding world''' and the '''[[Muggle]] world'''. The Muggle world is the series' name for the world inhabited by the non-magical majority, with the wizarding world existing [[wikt:coextensive|coextensively]] with it but hidden from the awareness of the non-magical "[[Muggle]]s". The plot of the series is set in contemporary [[Great Britain]], but in a veiled and separate shadow society in which [[Magic in Harry Potter|magic]] is real, and those who can use it live in enforced seclusion, hiding their talents from the real world. The term "wizarding world" refers to the global wizard community that lives hidden in parallel with the Muggle world; the different terms refer to different communities within the same area rather than separate [[planets]] or worlds.
